channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023100850
item.description:
Report E-2023100850

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USA experienced a UN1197 Carmel FMF Liquid Concentrate Flavor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack at the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of zep clog attack (un1760) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner ply 1 gallon jug had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of strip acetone (un1090) had been crushed by other freight and had released 2 gallons of product from 2 of the inner metal 1 gallon cans. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023100225
item.description:
Report X-2023100225

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to the station by driver. Found by VSA desk with box in wet and torn condition. DescribePack: Inspection of contents resulted in cap being loose/failed. No holes, puncture marks or cracks visible on the damaged container. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Better handling of the package from the handlers to the driver. If the package was kept upright like it is supposed to, then this spill would have never happened.

item.title: Report X-2023100224
item.description:
Report X-2023100224

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called that there was hazmats that needed to be processed. When processing the hazmats there was a leakage on the floor around 8:30 pm. One of the steel drums had a punctured in it and was causing a leakage on the floor. DescribePack: It is a 20-liter steel drum, with a puncture hole near the bottom. The puncture mark the size of the thickness of a dime. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put drum in a hazmat bag with absorbent sheets

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Item was found by door v130 package handler informed me of a spilled hazmat package. DescribePack: Item was dropped causing item to crack and leak internally leaking out of the bottom of its packaging DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: We put neutralizing agent on to substance and checked its PH balance contained item immediately.

item.title: Report X-2023100143
item.description:
Report X-2023100143

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the load side. The hazmat came down the main chute from overhead sorter. The package handler called over the QA because he saw that it was some type of acid. DescribePack: After further inspection, the glass bottle inside was broken and leaked out all the liquid and caused the vapor to release, starting a reaction to the oxidized environment. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The area was treated with neutralizing power and cleaned up with proper PPE and the outside was cleaned up as well. The box then was taken to the HMPA for further processing and proper ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023082012

Report X-2023082012

  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA

  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pallet of pails of UN2735 appeared to have been transloaded onto a trailer and strapped to a wall, however some of the pails appeared to ~have shifted in transit, causing them to fall off a pallet where they were stacked 5 high. At least 2 of the pails broke open as they struck ~the floor of the tra iler and leaked. The leak was contained to the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023081733
item.description:
Report X-2023081733

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/6/2023 at approximately 0020, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 916791 at the hub facility in Oakland, reporting an undeclared paint spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one 2-liter metal can of paint. The shipment was disovered leaking during sort. It appears the closure failed on the inner container, resulting in spillage. Further investigation revealing that rthe contents that spilled appears to be paint, as the inner container is marked as "Coffee Bean Stain". The package is not marked, labeled, or prepared as dangerous goods shipment. The shipment has been placed in a salvage drum and being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.
